alert.note: Alert for Floyd; Mitchell (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LaCrosse (Southwestern Wisconsin, Southeastern Minnesota, and Northeast Iowa)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 25 at 12:55AM CDT by NWS LaCrosse
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Mitchell and Floyd Counties through 200 AM CDT... At 1255 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Manly to 7 miles west of Rockwell. Movement was east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... St. Ansgar around 115 AM CDT. Osage around 120 AM CDT. Rockford and Stacyville around 125 AM CDT. Rudd around 130 AM CDT. Riceville and Floyd around 145 AM CDT. Charles City around 150 AM CDT. Other locations impacted by these storms include Meyer, Toeterville, Rock Creek, Idlewilde State Park, Roseville, Brownville, and Oakwood. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 300 AM CDT for north central and northeastern Iowa.
